snippet: The National Transportation Safety Board is recommending that states reduce the allowable blood-alcohol content to 0.05 percent, instead of the current 0.08 percent.
abstract: National Transportation Safety Board is recommending that states reduce allowable blood-alcohol content for drivers by more than a third, to 0.05 percent from 0.08 percent; says progress has stalled and that 10,000 people die annually from drunk driving incidents.
lead_paragraph: The National Transportation Safety Board is recommending that states reduce the allowable blood-alcohol content to 0.05 percent, instead of the current 0.08 percent.

headline.seo: N.T.S.B. Endorses Lower Legal Alcohol Limit for Drivers
headline.main: States Urged to Cut Limit on Alcohol for Drivers
headline.print_headline: States Urged To Cut Limit On Alcohol For Drivers
